features: 【2.4GHz Wireless Technology】: This fantastic, reliable wireless technology has a long transmission distance. It has comparatively much better frequency than ISM bands. It also has a bidirectional transmission, allows system co-existence, and has substantial anti-interference.

【Wide Compatibility】: The game controller is compatible with - Windows (Xinput and Dinput), PS3, Switch. It is not compatible with - Xbox 360, Xbox One, Mac, iOS, Playstation 4, Amazon Fire TV, Amazon fire stick.

【M Buttons】: The presence of M buttons makes you a master manipulator. You can edit any complex operation as an M button. Combination keys are (A, B, X, Y, LB, RB, L3, LT, RT, R3). Direction keys are (up, down, left, and right).

【Dual Vibration】: Asymmetrical and linear vibrating motor delivers separate feedback during the game. It enhances the realism of game scenarios. It gives you an excellent gaming experience to take your immersion to the next level.

【Wireless & Wired Mode】: This is the most fantastic feature of this product. Once you are out of battery but are still willing to play, plug in the USB cable to connect the controller and game device, and switch to wired mode. Happy gaming!

In this world of technology, kids can never be far behind. Moreover, in this generation, in shortage of fields and gardens, video games have taken the lead. This new gaming controller has a brand new frequency (2.4GHz). It also has a strong anti-interference, system controller, and bidirectional transmission.

OTG support This wireless controller supports OTG. Now you can also connect your wireless game controller not only with Windows but also with Androids and Tablets. Programmable “M” Buttons Any complex operation, you can edit as “M” Buttons. The combination keys that can be set are: (A, B, X, Y, LB, RB, L3, LT, RT, R3, direction keys: up, down, left, right) Wireless+Wired Mode It has a dual-mode. Once your battery is dead, you can plug in the USB cable and keep your gaming going.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kids loved it
reviews.reviewText: The Forty4 Wireless Gaming Controller is an absolute hit in our household. This versatile game controller works seamlessly with PC Windows 7/8/10/11, PS3, and the Nintendo Switch, making it a go-to choice for our gaming needs. The dual-vibration feature adds an immersive element to our gaming experience, making every action feel more realistic.What truly sets this controller apart is how much the kids love it. Whether they're playing their favorite PC games or battling it out on the Switch, this controller never disappoints. Its comfortable grip and responsive buttons ensure that they can play for hours without any discomfort.In a world filled with gaming controllers, the Forty4 stands out for its quality and performance. It has become an integral part of our gaming setup, and we couldn't be happier with our purchase. If you're in search of a reliable and enjoyable gaming controller, look no further than the Forty4 Wireless Gaming Controller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have had no problems with this item so far. I have used it for gaming on pc and switch, I have had no problems with missed input or buttons not working, although I wish you could assign the back paddles a button on the switch but other than that I see this as a perfect controller for everyday use, I find it very comfortable and easy to hold when gaming for long periods of time. for the pc it is as easy as plugging in the dongle as well as for the normal switch just plugging the dongle into the dock, however for the switch lite you do have to have a USB-A Female to USB-C Male converter and if you do that it works perfectly.ps. make sure you enable pro controller wired communication on the switch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic value, solid little controller.
reviews.reviewText: A very solid controller. I have a few minor gripes to bring up with it. First, the triggers. The left trigger gives less resistance than the right trigger which, in fairness could be a slight defect with mine in particular. The button presses seperately feel fine but using them together feels strange to my hands. Next, the battery life. It dies unfortunately quickly compared to some of the other controllers I own. I'm sure turning the glow off would extend the battery life by a good amount but I really like the look of the controller when it's all lit up. Lastly, the rear buttons. Setting them up exactly how you want them is simple and it lets you do a surprising amount of things with them (first controller I've owned that lets you set up macros), however, the button placement leaves room for improvement. The two that are basically on the grips are wonderfully placed if not a bit on the small side, but the two closer to the center of the controller are incovenient to use if both thumbs are using the sticks. For many people the appeal of the rear buttons is to be able to press the face buttons while also having full movement and camera control, so having to almost take my thumb off the stick to be able to press them kind of defeats the point. They can still be useful as a macro button, but if they were positioned on the grips below the other buttons they'd be perfect. Everything else is as you would expect for a decent quality controller. The plastic feels sort of middling quality-wise, not the best I've ever held but far from the worst. Face buttons have a nice press to them, d-pad isn't too squishy, turbo button is fun to have. Overall it's a very good controller at a price that makes sense, I would recommend it for anyone looking to add some variety to their controller collection or even if you just need another controller for group sessions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect, but needs better manual...
reviews.reviewText: It just works, but based on the other reviews, I think it's biggest issue is the instructions...I use two of these with a HTPC running emulators on X-Input mode. Computer sees it as an xbox 360 controller. Works well with 2 other wireless controllers I use. So 4 wireless controllers all working at once, no issues.I wish there was an easy way to turn it off, or turn off the lights at least. They are pretty much always one when connected to a PC. The auto-off time is kinda long. Like 5 mins maybe? The other controllers I have turn off after just a minute or so. The manual might say something about this but it is all so convoluted....On to the issues these other people are having...This controller has multiple modes. The mode is indicated by the lights in the lower middle area. You hold down the home button to switch the mode. When I plugged in the dongle in and turned on the controller, my computer saw it has "controller c02" or something like that. This is not ideal, because I think it means that it is using D-Input. Either way, it didn't work in this mode for most things. Holding down the home button changed the mode and then my computer saw it as an xbox 360 controller. I assume that this is x-input mode. X-input is pretty much the standard mode on windows and most other devices. In this mode, it works perfectly with any game that can recognize x-input controllers, without even having to remap anything.So if you get this and it doesn't work with your device, try changing the mode by holding the home button. There are 4 modes, but it looks like just two x-input modes and 2 d-input modes.To finish things up, this has a TON of features, and the instruction manual is poorly worded and doesn't help in some cases. The M buttons on the back are cool, I guess, but I would've preferred if they were just seen as more buttons or something. The process for mapping them is in the manual, but hard to understand. I just want to turn them off, because sometimes I hit them on accident. With enough time, you could figure it out, but I just wanted to play games and now I am complacent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great. Good look & feel
reviews.reviewText: Obviously not exactly OEM quality but worth the buy.We do a lot of game streaming & this controller works perfectly on windows 11 for Xbox/microsoft Gamepass, Gamepass cloud, steamlink, steam & remote applications like parsec

Leí en las reseñas que no funciona con procesador AMD, yo tengo un Ryzen 7 y me funcionó muy bien, la instalación fue plug and play, solo conecte el adaptador USB y funcionó sin problemas ni configuración adicional.La configuración de los botones secundarios es muy sencilla, la batería interna es duradera, el botón turbo es muy útil, poder seleccionar el brillo se la luz de los botones y de el nivel de la vibración es algo que se agradece.La distancia en que uso el control/PC es alrededor de 3 mts y funciona sin problemas o lag.Muy buena compra, vale la pena por la relación calidad/precio ya que vengo de un control elite Xbox y no noto mucha diferencia.

Este mando superó mis expectativas.Toda mi vida he manejado la marca Play Station, por lo que usar este control al principio fue incómodo, pero después de dos días ya me acostumbré.Vibra más que mi control de ps4 y las luces me encantan.Lo estoy usando en Steam y sin problemas; al momento de configurarlo, fue rapidísimo y muy sencillo.Cuando lo pruebe en mi ps3, comentaré qué tal.*Actualización*Probado en PS3 y funciona mejor que el control de la consola original. ¬.¬Hasta el momento no he tenido problema alguno con el control, el Bluetooth funciona de maravilla y la batería sin usar el cable dura bastante.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen control con gatillos analogicos, sin lag usando el adaptador wifi, opción económica
reviews.reviewText: Lo mejor del control es su comodidad y su precio, no tiene latencia o lag al usarse con el adaptador inalámbrico y la batería tiene carga decente.Los botones L1 y R1 pueden mejorar ya que pueden tener falso contacto si no se aprietan firmemente, los gatillos son analógicos por lo que son perfectos para simuladores y juegos de conducción. Los botones traseros solo se pueden mapear a otras acciones de otro botón, no sirven como independientes, pero es fácil de utilizar.El control no tiene botón de apagado, se apaga solo tras desconectar el cable, adaptador inalámbrico o tras unos minutos de no usarse. La iluminación que tiene puede ser algo molesta jugando a oscuras, no hay forma de apagarla.

Perfecto en su función, viene todo lo que tiene en la descripción del artículo. Fácil de instalar. Cómodo y muy preciso en los movimientos, excelente funcion del Bluetooth y le dura bastante la batería.
El producto es excelente, compatible con todos los juegos que he probado.
